org.waarp.gateway.kernel.session

Class DefaultHttpAuth

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.waarp.gateway.kernel.session.DefaultHttpAuth
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AuthInterface, HttpAuthInterface

    public class DefaultHttpAuth
extends Object
implements HttpAuthInterface
    Allow all default implementation

    If an authentication is needed, then it will have to use an implementation compatible with the Security of the IT that needs it.

      • isIdentified

        public final boolean isIdentified()
        Description copied from interface: AuthInterface
        Is the current Authentication OK for full identification. It must be true after a correct sequence of identification: At most, it is true when setAccount is OK. It could be positive before (user name only, user+password only).
        In the current implementation, as USER+PASS+ACCT are needed, it will be true only after a correct ACCT.
        Specified by:
        isIdentified in interface AuthInterface
        Returns:
        True if the user has a positive login, else False

      • isAdmin

        public final boolean isAdmin()
        Specified by:
        isAdmin in interface AuthInterface
        Returns:
        True if the current authentication has an admin right (shutdown, bandwidth limitation)

        Returns:
